birds.name: Common Pheasant
birds.description: The Common Pheasant is a large, colorful bird with bright plumage. Males have metallic green heads and long tails, while females are more subdued. They are ground-dwelling birds, often found foraging for seeds and insects. During breeding season, males perform elaborate courtship displays. Their call is a series of loud cackles and crowing. Common Pheasants are widely distributed across Europe and Asia. They are commonly hunted game birds.

birds.name: Eurasian Wren
birds.description: The Eurasian Wren is a tiny, brown bird with a short tail that is often cocked upright. Despite its small size, it has a loud, melodious song that it uses to defend its territory and attract mates. It forages for insects among leaf litter and low vegetation. Eurasian Wrens are widespread across Europe and northern Asia, often found in dense vegetation. They are not migratory and maintain small territories year-round.

birds.name: European Robin
birds.description: The European Robin is a small, plump bird with a bright orange-red breast and face. It is known for its friendly behavior, often approaching humans closely. European Robins are territorial and sing year-round, especially during dawn and dusk. They feed on insects, worms, and berries. Found throughout Europe, they are widespread in a variety of habitats. European Robins are not threatened and are a familiar sight in gardens.

birds.name: Eurasian Bullfinch
birds.description: The Eurasian Bullfinch is a stocky bird with a black cap and face, contrasting with a pinkish-red breast and gray back. It feeds mainly on seeds, buds, and berries. During breeding season, males sing a soft, melodious whistle. Eurasian Bullfinches are shy and often seen in pairs or small flocks. They are widespread across Europe and Asia, favoring woodland edges and gardens. Despite habitat loss, they are not currently threatened.

birds.name: Common Blackbird
birds.description: The Common Blackbird is a medium-sized songbird with glossy black plumage and a bright yellow bill. Males are black with a yellow eye ring, while females are brown with streaked underparts. They forage on the ground for insects, earthworms, and berries. Common Blackbirds are territorial, especially during breeding season when males sing from prominent perches. They are widespread across Europe and adapt well to urban environments.

birds.name: Eurasian Sparrowhawk
birds.description: The Eurasian Sparrowhawk is a small bird of prey with short, broad wings and a long tail. Males have blue-gray upperparts and orange-barred underparts, while females are brown with bold streaking. They hunt small birds and mammals by surprise attacks, often from concealed perches. During breeding season, males perform courtship displays with steep dives and fluttering flights. Eurasian Sparrowhawks are widespread across Europe and Asia.

birds.name: Eurasian Blue Tit
birds.description: The Eurasian Blue Tit is a small, lively bird with bright blue and yellow plumage. It has a distinctive blue cap and white cheeks. Eurasian Blue Tits forage actively for insects, seeds, and berries, often hanging upside down from twigs and branches. They are known for their varied songs and calls, including trills and chattering. Found throughout Europe, they are common in a wide range of habitats, including urban areas.

birds.name: Eurasian Jay
birds.description: The Eurasian Jay is a colorful bird with pinkish-brown plumage, a black moustache stripe, and blue wing patches. It is known for its shy and secretive behavior, often heard rather than seen. Eurasian Jays are omnivorous, feeding on acorns, seeds, insects, and small vertebrates. They are highly vocal, producing a variety of harsh calls and mimicry. Found across Europe and Asia, they are adaptable to a range of wooded habitats.

birds.name: Eurasian Collared Dove
birds.description: The Eurasian Collared Dove is a medium-sized dove with pale gray-brown plumage and a distinctive black half-collar on its nape. It has a gentle cooing call that is often heard in urban and suburban environments. Eurasian Collared Doves feed mainly on seeds and grains, foraging on the ground in open areas. Originally from Asia, they have spread widely across Europe and are now a common sight in cities and towns.

birds.name: Eurasian Magpie
birds.description: The Eurasian Magpie is a striking black and white bird with a long tail and iridescent plumage. It is known for its intelligence and bold behavior. Eurasian Magpies are omnivorous, feeding on a wide range of food including insects, small mammals, eggs, and fruit. They are highly vocal, producing a variety of calls and mimicry. Found across Europe and Asia, they thrive in various habitats including urban areas.

birds.name: Eurasian Nuthatch
birds.description: The Eurasian Nuthatch is a small bird with blue-gray upperparts, orange-buff underparts, and a black eyestripe. It has a short tail and strong feet for climbing tree trunks headfirst. Eurasian Nuthatches forage for insects and seeds, often caching food in bark crevices. They are known for their loud, repetitive calls and frequent visits to bird feeders. Found across Europe and Asia, they are resident birds and do not migrate.

birds.name: European Goldfinch
birds.description: The European Goldfinch is a small, colorful finch with a red face, black and white head markings, and yellow wing bars. It feeds primarily on seeds, especially from thistles and teasels. European Goldfinches are highly social, often seen in small flocks. They have a melodious twittering song and perform undulating flight displays during courtship. Found throughout Europe, they are common in gardens and urban areas.

birds.name: Common Chiffchaff
birds.description: The Common Chiffchaff is a small, plain greenish-brown warbler with pale underparts and a short bill. It feeds on insects, picking them from leaves and branches. Common Chiffchaffs have a distinctive repetitive song that sounds like 'chiff-chaff', often heard during spring and summer. They are migratory, wintering in southern Europe and Africa. Found across Europe, they prefer dense vegetation near water.

birds.name: Eurasian Blackcap
birds.description: The Eurasian Blackcap is a medium-sized warbler with gray-brown upperparts and a black cap on males (brown cap on females). It has a distinctive fluting song that varies in complexity. Eurasian Blackcaps feed on insects and berries, foraging in shrubs and trees. They are migratory, breeding in Europe and wintering in southern Europe and Africa. Common in a variety of habitats, they are often seen in gardens and parks.

birds.name: Eurasian Treecreeper
birds.description: The Eurasian Treecreeper is a small bird with mottled brown plumage and a curved bill. It has a habit of climbing tree trunks spirally in search of insects and spiders. Eurasian Treecreepers have a thin, high-pitched song and a sharp 'seee' call. They are widespread across Europe and northern Asia, favoring mature forests with dense tree cover. They are non-migratory and maintain year-round territories.

birds.name: European Greenfinch
birds.description: The European Greenfinch is a robust finch with a greenish-yellow body, yellow wing patches, and a thick bill. It feeds on seeds and buds, often visiting bird feeders. European Greenfinches have a melodious song with twittering phrases. They are social birds, often seen in flocks. Found across Europe, they are common in a variety of habitats including gardens and farmlands.

birds.name: Eurasian Siskin
birds.description: The Eurasian Siskin is a small finch with a streaked yellow-green body, black cap, and forked tail. It feeds on seeds, especially from alder and birch trees. Eurasian Siskins have a twittering call and a buzzing flight sound. They are social birds, often forming mixed flocks with other finches. Found across Europe and Asia, they breed in coniferous forests and migrate southward in winter.

birds.name: Common Kingfisher
birds.description: The Common Kingfisher is a small, colorful bird with bright blue upperparts and orange underparts. It has a short tail and a long, dagger-like bill for catching fish. Common Kingfishers hover over water before diving headfirst to catch prey. They have a high-pitched whistle and harsh 'chik' call. Found across Europe and Asia, they are associated with clean, slow-flowing water bodies with abundant fish.

birds.name: Eurasian Wryneck
birds.description: The Eurasian Wryneck is a small, brownish bird with intricate barring and a cryptic pattern that helps it blend into tree bark. It has a long, barbed tongue adapted for extracting insects from crevices. Eurasian Wrynecks have a distinctive habit of twisting their necks when alarmed. They are migratory, breeding in Europe and wintering in sub-Saharan Africa. Found in open woodlands and orchards, they are shy and solitary birds.

birds.name: European Pied Flycatcher
birds.description: The European Pied Flycatcher is a small, black and white bird with a bold pattern of contrasting colors. Males have a striking black-and-white plumage, while females are more subdued with gray-brown tones. They catch insects on the wing, often perching on exposed branches or fences. European Pied Flycatchers have a melodious song and a loud 'peet-peet' call. Found across Europe, they migrate to Africa for the winter.

birds.name: Common Redstart
birds.description: The Common Redstart is a small, colorful bird with slate-gray upperparts and bright orange underparts and tail. Males have a distinctive red tail, while females are duller with a grayish-brown tail. They forage for insects by hopping on the ground or catching them in mid-air. Common Redstarts have a warbling song and a sharp 'tseep' call. They breed in Europe and winter in sub-Saharan Africa.

birds.name: Eurasian Hoopoe
birds.description: The Eurasian Hoopoe is a distinctive bird with a long, curved bill, black and white wings, and a crest of feathers that it can raise into a 'crown'. It has pinkish-brown plumage and a barred tail. Eurasian Hoopoes feed on insects, probing the ground with their bills. They are known for their 'hoop-hoop' call and musical trill during courtship displays. Found across Europe and Asia, they prefer open habitats with short grass.

birds.name: European Turtle Dove
birds.description: The European Turtle Dove is a small, elegant dove with a mottled brown plumage, pinkish breast, and a distinctive purring call. It feeds on seeds and grains, often foraging on the ground in open habitats. European Turtle Doves have a soft, rhythmic 'tur-tur' song during courtship displays. They are migratory, breeding in Europe and wintering in Africa. Population declines have made them a conservation concern in some regions.

birds.name: Eurasian Tree Sparrow
birds.description: The Eurasian Tree Sparrow is a small, brown and gray bird with a chestnut crown and black cheek spot. It is similar to the House Sparrow but smaller and with a distinctive call. Eurasian Tree Sparrows feed on seeds, insects, and crumbs in urban and rural environments. They have a chattering call and nest in colonies. Found across Europe and Asia, they are adaptable to various habitats but prefer areas with access to food and shelter.

birds.name: Eurasian Skylark
birds.description: The Eurasian Skylark is a small, brown bird with streaked plumage and a crest that it raises during its distinctive 'sky dance' display. It has a melodious song that starts with a series of warbling notes followed by a fast trill. Eurasian Skylarks feed on seeds and insects, foraging on the ground in open habitats. Found across Europe and Asia, they are widespread in agricultural landscapes but declining in some regions due to habitat loss.

birds.name: Eurasian Golden Oriole
birds.description: The Eurasian Golden Oriole is a striking bird with bright yellow plumage, black wings, and a black eye stripe on males (females are duller with greenish-yellow tones). They feed on insects and fruits, often high in trees. Eurasian Golden Orioles have a flute-like, melodious song that carries through woodland canopies. They are migratory, breeding in Europe and wintering in Africa. Found in mature forests and orchards, they are shy and elusive.

birds.name: Common Swift
birds.description: The Common Swift is a slender bird with long, curved wings and a short forked tail. It has dark brown plumage and a pale throat. Common Swifts are superb fliers, spending most of their lives in the air. They feed on flying insects caught on the wing. Common Swifts have a high-pitched screaming call and are known for their aerial acrobatics. Found across Europe and Asia, they migrate to Africa for the winter.

birds.name: European Green Woodpecker
birds.description: The European Green Woodpecker is a large woodpecker with bright green upperparts, yellow rump, and red crown in males (lacking in females). It has a distinctive laughing call and a 'yaffling' sound produced during territorial disputes. European Green Woodpeckers feed mainly on ants and larvae, probing into anthills with their long tongues. Found across Europe and parts of Asia, they are common in open woodlands and grassy areas.

birds.name: Common Starling
birds.description: The Common Starling is a medium-sized bird with iridescent black plumage, speckled with white spots in winter. It has a short, squared tail and a long, pointed bill. Common Starlings are highly social, forming large flocks and performing aerial displays. They mimic other birds and environmental sounds. Common Starlings feed on insects, seeds, and fruits. Found across Europe and Asia, they are adaptable to urban and rural habitats.

birds.name: Common Linnet
birds.description: The Common Linnet is a small finch with a streaked brown back, pinkish breast, and a red forehead in males during the breeding season. Females are duller with less red on the head. Common Linnets feed on seeds and insects, foraging on the ground and in low shrubs. They have a twittering song and a sharp 'chit' call. Common Linnets breed across Europe and western Asia, often seen in open habitats with scattered bushes.

birds.name: Common Wood Pigeon
birds.description: The Common Wood Pigeon is a large, gray-blue pigeon with a white patch on its neck and white wing patches. It has a cooing call that is familiar in rural and urban environments. Common Wood Pigeons feed on seeds, grains, and leafy vegetation, foraging on the ground and in trees. Found across Europe and Asia, they are common in woodlands, parks, and farmlands. They are non-migratory and form large flocks in winter.

birds.name: Eurasian Coot
birds.description: The Eurasian Coot is a medium-sized water bird with dark gray plumage, a white bill, and a distinctive white frontal shield. It has lobed feet adapted for swimming and diving. Eurasian Coots are territorial and aggressive during the breeding season, often chasing intruders away. They feed on aquatic plants, insects, and small fish. Eurasian Coots are widespread across Europe and Asia, inhabiting freshwater lakes, ponds, and marshes.

birds.name: Eurasian Curlew
birds.description: The Eurasian Curlew is a large wader with mottled brown plumage, a long, down-curved bill, and long legs. It has a haunting 'cur-lee' call that carries over open landscapes. Eurasian Curlews probe mudflats and wetlands for invertebrates and small crustaceans. They breed across northern Europe and migrate to coastal areas in winter. Eurasian Curlews are vulnerable due to habitat loss and hunting in some regions.

birds.name: Northern Lapwing
birds.description: The Northern Lapwing is a medium-sized wader with a distinctive black and white plumage, greenish back, and a wispy crest. They have a unique flight pattern with broad, rounded wings and slow wingbeats. Northern Lapwings feed on insects and other small invertebrates found in wet soils. They are common across Europe and Asia, especially in wetland areas.

birds.name: Eurasian Woodcock
birds.description: The Eurasian Woodcock is a stocky wader with mottled brown plumage, large eyes set high on the head, and a long, straight bill. They are nocturnal and often difficult to spot during the day. Eurasian Woodcocks feed on invertebrates, primarily earthworms, found in damp soils. They are widespread across Europe and Asia, with migratory populations moving to milder areas in winter.

birds.name: Common Snipe
birds.description: The Common Snipe is a small, cryptically colored wader with a long, straight bill and distinctive flight pattern, characterized by zigzagging and erratic movements. They feed on insects, worms, and other invertebrates in muddy soils. Common Snipes are found across Europe, Asia, and North America, often migrating to warmer regions in winter.

birds.name: Black-tailed Godwit
birds.description: The Black-tailed Godwit is a large wader with long legs, a straight bill, and distinctive black and white wing patterns in flight. They have reddish-brown plumage during the breeding season, which becomes duller in winter. Black-tailed Godwits feed on insects, mollusks, and worms in wet soils. They are found across Europe and Asia, migrating to Africa and southern Asia in winter.

birds.name: Common Redshank
birds.description: The Common Redshank is a medium-sized wader with distinctive red legs and a straight bill with a red base. They have a mottled brown and white plumage and a characteristic teetering motion when foraging. Common Redshanks feed on insects, mollusks, and crustaceans. They are widespread across Europe and Asia, with populations migrating to Africa and southern Asia in winter.

birds.name: Green Sandpiper
birds.description: The Green Sandpiper is a small wader with dark greenish-brown upperparts and white underparts. They have a distinctive, high-pitched call and are often seen alone or in small groups. Green Sandpipers feed on insects, mollusks, and crustaceans in shallow waters. They breed in northern Europe and Asia and migrate to Africa and southern Asia in winter.

birds.name: Common Sandpiper
birds.description: The Common Sandpiper is a small wader with brown upperparts, white underparts, and a distinctive white 'shoulder strap'. They have a bobbing motion when foraging and a characteristic fluttering flight with stiff wings. Common Sandpipers feed on insects, crustaceans, and other invertebrates. They breed in Europe and Asia and migrate to Africa and southern Asia in winter.

birds.name: Dunlin
birds.description: The Dunlin is a small wader with a distinctive black belly patch in breeding plumage, which becomes duller in winter. They have a slightly down-curved bill and brown upperparts. Dunlins feed on insects, mollusks, and crustaceans in mudflats and shallow waters. They are found across Europe, Asia, and North America, migrating to warmer regions in winter.

birds.name: Ruff
birds.description: The Ruff is a medium-sized wader with a distinctive breeding plumage in males, including a ruff of feathers around the neck and varied color patterns. Females and non-breeding males have a plainer appearance. Ruffs feed on insects, mollusks, and other invertebrates. They breed in northern Europe and Asia and migrate to Africa and southern Asia in winter.

birds.name: Eurasian Oystercatcher
birds.description: The Eurasian Oystercatcher is a large, black and white wader with a long, bright orange bill used to pry open shellfish. They have a loud, piping call and are often seen in coastal areas. Eurasian Oystercatchers feed on mollusks, crustaceans, and worms. They are found across Europe and Asia, especially along coastlines.

birds.name: Barn Swallow
birds.description: The Barn Swallow is a small bird with iridescent blue upperparts, a reddish-brown throat, and a deeply forked tail. They are agile fliers, often seen skimming low over fields and water bodies. Barn Swallows feed on insects caught in flight. They are widespread across Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas.

birds.name: House Sparrow
birds.description: The House Sparrow is a small, chunky bird with brown and gray plumage. Males have a distinctive black bib and white cheeks. They are highly adaptable and often found near human habitation. House Sparrows feed on seeds, grains, and insects. They are widespread across Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas.

birds.name: Willow Warbler
birds.description: The Willow Warbler is a small, delicate bird with greenish-brown upperparts and pale underparts. They have a distinctive, melodic song. Willow Warblers feed on insects and spiders. They are widespread across Europe and western Asia, migrating to sub-Saharan Africa for the winter.

birds.name: Common Chaffinch
birds.description: The Common Chaffinch is a small finch with a blue-gray crown, rust-colored underparts, and greenish back. Males are brightly colored, while females are duller. Common Chaffinches feed on seeds and insects. They are widespread across Europe, Asia, and North Africa.

birds.name: Great Tit
birds.description: The Great Tit is a large, colorful tit with a black head, white cheeks, and yellow underparts. They are active and vocal birds, often seen in mixed flocks. Great Tits feed on insects, seeds, and nuts. They are widespread across Europe, Asia, and North Africa.

birds.name: Eurasian Reed Warbler
birds.description: The Eurasian Reed Warbler is a small, brown bird with a long bill and rounded tail. They are often seen clinging to reed stems. Eurasian Reed Warblers feed on insects and spiders. They are widespread across Europe, Asia, and Africa, migrating to sub-Saharan Africa for the winter.

birds.name: Common Whitethroat
birds.description: The Common Whitethroat is a small warbler with grayish-brown upperparts, white underparts, and a distinctive white throat. Males have a slight pinkish tinge to the chest. Common Whitethroats feed on insects and berries. They are widespread across Europe, Asia, and Africa, migrating to sub-Saharan Africa for the winter.

birds.name: Eurasian Reed Bunting
birds.description: The Eurasian Reed Bunting is a small bird with brown streaked plumage and a distinctive black head and white collar in males. They are often seen in wetland areas. Eurasian Reed Buntings feed on seeds and insects. They are widespread across Europe, Asia, and North Africa.

birds.name: Common Kestrel
birds.description: The Common Kestrel is a small falcon with a distinctive hovering flight while hunting. Males have a gray head and tail, while females are uniformly brown. They feed primarily on small mammals and birds. Common Kestrels are found across Europe, Asia, and Africa.

birds.name: Western Yellow Wagtail
birds.description: The Western Yellow Wagtail is a small passerine with bright yellow underparts and an olive-green back. They are often seen foraging for insects in open fields and wetlands. Western Yellow Wagtails are migratory birds found across Europe, Asia, and Africa.

birds.name: Eurasian Tree Pipit
birds.description: The Eurasian Tree Pipit is a small, streaky brown bird with a slender bill. They perform distinctive song flights, rising and parachuting back down to a perch. Eurasian Tree Pipits feed on insects and seeds and are found across Europe and western Asia.

birds.name: Common Redpoll
birds.description: The Common Redpoll is a small finch with a red cap and black chin. Males often have a pinkish breast. They feed on seeds and are highly sociable, often seen in flocks. Common Redpolls are found across the Arctic and sub-Arctic regions of Europe, Asia, and North America.

birds.name: Eurasian Crag Martin
birds.description: The Eurasian Crag Martin is a small, dusky swallow with a square tail and white tail spots. They are agile flyers, often seen around rocky cliffs and buildings. Eurasian Crag Martins feed on insects and are found in southern Europe, North Africa, and Asia.

birds.name: European Serin
birds.description: The European Serin is a small, bright yellow finch with streaked upperparts and a short, forked tail. They have a fast, twittering song and are often seen in flocks. European Serins feed on seeds and are found across southern and central Europe.

birds.name: European Stonechat
birds.description: The European Stonechat is a small, plump bird with a black head, white collar, and orange-red breast. They are often seen perched on low shrubs and fence posts. European Stonechats feed on insects and berries. They are found across Europe and western Asia.

birds.name: Bearded Reedling
birds.description: The Bearded Reedling, also known as the Bearded Tit, is a small, long-tailed bird with distinctive black 'moustaches' on males. They are often seen clinging to reed stems, feeding on insects and seeds. Bearded Reedlings are found in Europe and Asia.

birds.name: Common Grasshopper Warbler
birds.description: The Common Grasshopper Warbler is a small, brown bird with streaked upperparts and pale underparts. They have a distinctive, reeling song that resembles a grasshopper. Common Grasshopper Warblers are found across Europe, Asia, and North Africa.

birds.name: Marsh Tit
birds.description: The Marsh Tit is a small, non-migratory bird with a distinctive black cap and bib. It feeds on insects and seeds and is known for its distinctive 'pitchoo' call.

birds.name: Dunnock
birds.description: The Dunnock is a small, brown and grey bird with a thin bill. It is often seen foraging on the ground for insects and seeds. It is also known as the Hedge Sparrow.

birds.name: Goldcrest
birds.description: The Goldcrest is Europe's smallest bird, with a distinctive golden stripe on its head. It feeds on insects and spiders and has a high-pitched, rapid song.

birds.name: Firecrest
birds.description: The Firecrest is similar to the Goldcrest but has a distinctive orange stripe on its head. It feeds on insects and spiders and has a rapid, high-pitched song.

birds.name: Coal Tit
birds.description: The Coal Tit is a small bird with a distinctive black cap and bib, and white cheeks. It feeds on insects and seeds and has a distinctive high-pitched call.

birds.name: Long-tailed Tit
birds.description: The Long-tailed Tit is a small bird with a distinctive long tail and black, white, and pink plumage. It feeds on insects and spiders and is often seen in flocks.

birds.name: Red-backed Shrike
birds.description: The Red-backed Shrike is a small bird with a distinctive black mask and red-brown back. It is known for impaling its prey on thorns. It feeds on insects, small birds, and mammals.

birds.name: Willow Tit
birds.description: The Willow Tit is a small, non-migratory bird with a distinctive black cap and bib. It feeds on insects and seeds and has a distinctive 'chay-chay' call.

birds.name: Lesser Redpoll
birds.description: The Lesser Redpoll is a small finch with streaked brown plumage and a distinctive red cap. It feeds on seeds and insects and has a rapid, twittering song.

birds.name: Spotted Flycatcher
birds.description: The Spotted Flycatcher is a small bird with grey-brown plumage and a distinctive habit of sallying out from perches to catch insects. It is migratory, breeding in Europe and western Asia and wintering in Africa.

birds.name: Common Firecrest
birds.description: The Common Firecrest is similar to the Goldcrest but has a distinctive orange stripe on its head. It feeds on insects and spiders and has a rapid, high-pitched song.

birds.name: Black Redstart
birds.habitat: Urban areas, rocky areas, open woodlands
birds.description: The Black Redstart is a small bird with dark grey plumage and a distinctive red tail. It feeds on insects and berries and has a rapid, twittering song.

birds.name: Red-breasted Flycatcher
birds.description: The Red-breasted Flycatcher is a small bird with grey-brown plumage and a distinctive red-orange throat. It is migratory, breeding in Europe and western Asia and wintering in South Asia.

birds.name: White Wagtail
birds.description: The White Wagtail is a small bird with a distinctive black and white plumage and a long, constantly wagging tail. It feeds on insects and is often seen near water.

birds.name: Grey Wagtail
birds.description: The Grey Wagtail is a small bird with grey upperparts, yellow underparts, and a long, constantly wagging tail. It feeds on insects and is often seen near fast-flowing water.

birds.name: Northern Goshawk
birds.description: The Northern Goshawk is a large bird of prey with broad wings and a long tail. They are powerful hunters of birds and mammals, often hunting in dense forests.

birds.name: Common Buzzard
birds.description: The Common Buzzard is a medium-sized raptor with variable plumage, ranging from dark brown to much lighter variants. It soars on broad wings and is often seen perched on poles or trees, hunting for small mammals, birds, and reptiles.

birds.name: Eurasian Hobby
birds.description: The Eurasian Hobby is a small, slender falcon known for its acrobatic flight and rapid hunting skills. It catches insects and small birds mid-air. Its plumage is dark slate-grey above and buff below, with a distinctive black 'moustache'.

birds.name: Great Cormorant
birds.description: The Great Cormorant is a large black waterbird with a long neck and powerful bill. It dives underwater to catch fish and is often seen drying its wings in the sun. It nests in colonies on cliffs or in trees near water.

birds.name: Eurasian Teal
birds.description: The Eurasian Teal is a small duck with distinctive green and black speculum on the wings and a green patch on the head in males. It frequents freshwater wetlands and feeds on aquatic plants and invertebrates. It is known for its whistling call.

birds.name: Northern Shoveler
birds.description: The Northern Shoveler is a medium-sized duck known for its distinctive large, spoon-shaped bill. Males have bright plumage with green heads, white breasts, and chestnut flanks. They feed by filtering water for invertebrates and seeds.

birds.name: Common Goldeneye
birds.description: The Common Goldeneye is a medium-sized diving duck with striking black and white plumage in males and a golden eye. It nests in tree cavities and dives to catch fish and invertebrates. It is known for its distinctive whistling wingbeats.

birds.name: Red Kite
birds.description: The Red Kite is a large bird of prey with a reddish-brown body, forked tail, and distinctive white patches under the wings. It feeds on carrion and small animals and is known for its graceful, soaring flight. It has seen a resurgence in numbers due to conservation efforts.

birds.name: Common Moorhen
birds.description: The Common Moorhen is a medium-sized water bird with a distinctive red and yellow bill and long, greenish legs. It has a dark plumage with white streaks on the flanks. It is often seen walking on floating vegetation or swimming in wetlands.

birds.name: Northern Wheatear
birds.description: The Northern Wheatear is a small, ground-dwelling bird with a distinctive white rump and tail. Males have a black eye mask and grey back, while females are browner. It feeds on insects and migrates long distances between breeding and wintering grounds.

birds.name: Common Ringed Plover
birds.description: The Common Ringed Plover is a small wader with a distinctive black ring around its neck and a black-tipped orange bill. It forages on sandy and muddy shores for insects, worms, and crustaceans. It nests on the ground in open areas.

birds.name: Black-headed Gull
birds.description: The Black-headed Gull is a small gull with a chocolate-brown head in breeding plumage (white in winter), white body, and grey wings. It is often seen in flocks, feeding on insects, fish, and scraps. It is a noisy bird with a distinctive, harsh call.

birds.name: Common Tern
birds.description: The Common Tern is a medium-sized seabird with a slender body, forked tail, and pointed wings. It has a black cap, white body, and grey wings. It feeds on fish, diving into the water from flight. Its call is a sharp, rasping 'kee-arr'.

birds.name: Great Egret
birds.description: The Great Egret is a large, elegant white heron with a long, yellow bill and black legs. It wades through shallow water to catch fish, frogs, and insects. It nests in colonies, often with other herons, in trees near water.

birds.name: Little Grebe
birds.description: The Little Grebe is a small, brown diving bird with a distinctive fluffy rear end. It is often seen on still or slow-moving water, where it dives for small fish, insects, and other invertebrates. Known for its trilling calls during the breeding season.

birds.name: Common Eider
birds.description: The Common Eider is a large sea duck, recognizable by its bulky shape and black-and-white plumage in males. It feeds on crustaceans and mollusks, diving deep to catch its prey. Eiders are known for their soft down, which is harvested sustainably from nests.

birds.name: Garganey
birds.description: The Garganey is a small dabbling duck, with males showing a distinctive white eyebrow stripe during the breeding season. It feeds on aquatic plants and invertebrates, often found in shallow marshes and flooded fields.

birds.name: Red-necked Grebe
birds.description: The Red-necked Grebe is a medium-sized grebe with a distinctive red neck and white cheeks during breeding season. It dives for fish and aquatic invertebrates, and builds floating nests in reeds.

birds.name: Common Scoter
birds.description: The Common Scoter is a sea duck, with males showing an all-black plumage. It is often seen in large flocks on coastal waters, diving for mollusks and crustaceans. Known for its distinct whistling calls during courtship.

birds.name: Black Grouse
birds.description: The Black Grouse is a large bird with males displaying striking black plumage and lyre-shaped tail feathers. They are known for their impressive lekking displays during the breeding season, where males compete for females with calls and dances.

birds.name: Western Capercaillie
birds.description: The Western Capercaillie is a large, turkey-sized bird with males exhibiting dark, iridescent plumage and an elaborate display during mating season. It feeds on a variety of plant material, including berries and shoots. Known for its deep, booming call.

birds.name: Eurasian Bittern
birds.description: The Eurasian Bittern is a secretive heron with mottled brown plumage, perfect for blending into its reedbed habitat. It is known for its booming call, which can be heard during the breeding season. It feeds mainly on fish and amphibians.

birds.name: Purple Heron
birds.description: The Purple Heron is a large, slender bird with a striking purple and chestnut plumage. It is often seen stalking through reedbeds in search of fish, frogs, and insects. Known for its slow, deliberate movements and long, sinuous neck.

birds.name: Great White Pelican
birds.description: The Great White Pelican is a large water bird with a distinctive long bill and a large throat pouch. It is often seen fishing in groups, using cooperative hunting techniques to herd fish. Known for its graceful flight and large breeding colonies.

birds.name: Peregrine Falcon
birds.description: The Peregrine Falcon is a powerful bird of prey known for its incredible speed, making it one of the fastest animals on earth. It has a distinctive blue-grey back and barred underparts. It hunts birds in mid-air, using a high-speed dive called a stoop.

birds.name: Great Grey Shrike
birds.description: The Great Grey Shrike is a medium-sized passerine bird with a distinctive black mask and grey plumage. It is known for its habit of impaling prey, such as insects and small birds, on thorns or barbed wire. It uses elevated perches to hunt.

birds.name: European Honey Buzzard
birds.description: The European Honey Buzzard is a medium-sized bird of prey with a long neck and small head, resembling a pigeon. It feeds mainly on the larvae and nests of wasps and bees. Known for its distinctive, slow, and buoyant flight.

birds.name: Red-footed Falcon
birds.description: The Red-footed Falcon is a small bird of prey, with males showing blue-grey plumage and red legs. It feeds on insects and small birds, often seen hunting over open fields. Known for its agile flight and communal roosting behavior.

birds.name: Corn Crake
birds.description: The Corn Crake is a secretive bird, known for its distinctive rasping call heard during the breeding season. It has a streaked brown plumage, blending well into its grassy habitat. It feeds on insects and seeds, often difficult to spot due to its skulking nature.

birds.name: Common Crane
birds.description: The Common Crane is a large, stately bird with grey plumage, a red crown, and black wingtips. It is known for its impressive migratory flocks and elaborate courtship dances. It feeds on a variety of plant and animal matter found in wetlands and fields.

birds.name: Eurasian Golden Plover
birds.description: The Eurasian Golden Plover is a medium-sized wader with distinctive gold-spotted plumage and a white belly during the breeding season. It is known for its melodic whistling call. It feeds on insects, worms, and other invertebrates.

birds.name: European Nightjar
birds.description: The European Nightjar is a nocturnal bird with cryptic, mottled brown plumage. It is known for its distinctive churring song heard at dusk. It feeds on flying insects, catching them in flight with its wide mouth.

birds.name: Common Cuckoo
birds.description: The Common Cuckoo is a slender bird known for its distinctive 'cuckoo' call. It is a brood parasite, laying its eggs in the nests of other bird species. It feeds on insects and caterpillars, often seen perched on branches.

birds.name: Wood Warbler
birds.description: The Wood Warbler is a small, greenish-yellow bird with a distinctive, trilling song. It is found in mature deciduous forests, where it feeds on insects and spiders. Known for its rapid, fluttering flight and characteristic tail movements.

birds.name: Eurasian Penduline Tit
birds.description: The Eurasian Penduline Tit is a small bird with a distinctive black mask and brownish-grey plumage. It is known for its intricate, hanging nests woven from plant fibers. It feeds on insects, spiders, and seeds, often seen in wetland habitats.

birds.name: European Bee-eater
birds.description: The European Bee-eater is a colorful bird with a mix of blue, green, and yellow plumage. It is known for its acrobatic flight and diet of flying insects, particularly bees and wasps. It nests in burrows dug into sandy banks.

birds.name: Eurasian Dotterel
birds.description: The Eurasian Dotterel is a small, plump bird with a striking chestnut breast and a white stripe above the eye. It breeds in high mountain and tundra regions, where it feeds on insects and other small invertebrates. Known for its distinctive 'peep' calls.

birds.name: Great Reed Warbler
birds.description: The Great Reed Warbler is a large, robust warbler with a loud, harsh song. It is found in reedbeds and wetland areas, where it feeds on insects and other small invertebrates. Known for its aggressive territorial behavior during the breeding season.

birds.name: Northern Fulmar
birds.description: The Northern Fulmar is a seabird with a stocky body and stiff-winged flight. It is found on coastal cliffs and over the open ocean, where it feeds on fish, squid, and other marine organisms. Known for its tube-shaped nostrils and ability to spit stomach oil as a defense mechanism.

birds.name: Common Nightingale
birds.description: The Common Nightingale is a small, plain-looking bird known for its powerful and beautiful song. It is found in deciduous woodlands and thickets, where it feeds on insects and other small invertebrates.

birds.name: Black Woodpecker
birds.description: The Black Woodpecker is a large woodpecker with a black body and a red cap. It is found in mature forests, where it feeds on insects and larvae found in decaying wood. Known for its distinctive drumming on trees.

birds.name: Short-eared Owl
birds.description: The Short-eared Owl is a medium-sized owl with a round head and short ear tufts. It is found in grasslands and open country, where it hunts for small mammals and birds. Known for its buoyant, moth-like flight.

birds.name: Rock Ptarmigan
birds.description: The Rock Ptarmigan is a medium-sized game bird with a white winter plumage and mottled brown summer plumage. It is found in alpine and arctic tundra, where it feeds on plants and insects. Known for its ability to blend into its surroundings.

birds.name: Lesser Spotted Woodpecker
birds.description: The Lesser Spotted Woodpecker is a small woodpecker with a distinctive black-and-white plumage and a red cap on males. It is found in deciduous forests and woodlands, where it feeds on insects and larvae found in dead wood.

birds.name: Hawfinch
birds.description: The Hawfinch is a large finch with a powerful bill and a distinctive, chunky appearance. It is found in deciduous forests and orchards, where it feeds on seeds, nuts, and fruit. Known for its strong, conical bill used to crack open hard seeds.

birds.name: Red-throated Pipit
birds.description: The Red-throated Pipit is a small, slender bird with a distinctive red throat during the breeding season. It is found in tundra and open grasslands, where it feeds on insects and seeds. Known for its high-pitched, trilling call.

birds.name: Little Owl
birds.description: The Little Owl is a small owl with a stocky body and a distinctive, expressive face. It is found in open countryside and farmlands, where it hunts for small mammals, birds, and insects. Known for its distinctive 'kiew' call.

birds.name: Bluethroat
birds.description: The Bluethroat is a small bird with a striking blue throat and a reddish-brown tail. It is found in wetlands and scrubby areas, where it feeds on insects and other small invertebrates. Known for its rich, varied song.

birds.name: Yellowhammer
birds.description: The Yellowhammer is a small bird with a bright yellow head and underparts and brown streaked upperparts. It is found in farmlands and open countryside, where it feeds on seeds and insects. Known for its distinctive, repetitive song.

birds.name: White Stork
birds.description: The White Stork is a large wading bird with a white body, black wingtips, and a long, red bill. It is found in wetlands and farmlands, where it feeds on amphibians, insects, and small mammals. Known for its distinctive bill-clattering display during the breeding season.

birds.name: Common Whitethroat
birds.description: The Common Whitethroat is a medium-sized warbler with a grey head, white throat, and brownish upperparts. It is found in hedgerows and scrublands, where it feeds on insects and berries. Known for its scratchy, musical song.

birds.name: Song Thrush
birds.description: The song thrush is a small to medium-sized songbird known for its melodic and repetitive song, which it often sings from high perches in woodland areas. Native to Europe, Asia, and parts of North Africa, the song thrush is easily recognizable by its warm brown upperparts and creamy, speckled underparts. This bird is a skilled forager, frequently seen hopping on the ground in search of earthworms, snails, and insects. The song thrush is celebrated in literature and poetry for its enchanting song, which includes a series of varied and rich phrases repeated two to four times. Although its population has declined in some regions due to habitat loss and changes in agricultural practices, the song thrush remains a beloved symbol of the natural worlds musicality.

birds.name: Bearded Vulture
birds.description: The bearded vulture, scientifically known as Gypaetus barbatus, is a distinctive bird of prey found in mountainous regions of Europe, Asia, and Africa. Its most striking feature is its vivid red-orange feathered face, contrasting sharply with its black plumage. This vulture is renowned for its unique feeding habits, which include dropping bones from heights to access marrow, hence its nickname "bone-eating vulture." It plays a crucial role in its ecosystem by consuming carrion and helping to clean up the environment. The bearded vulture is culturally significant in many regions and is considered a symbol of wilderness and rugged landscapes.
